intro: Corchoropsis intermedia, commonly known as the African mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its alternate leaves with palmate venation and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Corchoropsis intermedia is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses in various African cultures.
